sw_basic_functions module

sw_basic_functions.SmilesToPDB(smiles_string, output_file)[source]

Converts a SMILES string to a PDB file.

Parameters:

  • smiles_string (str) – The SMILES string of the molecule.

  • output_file (str) – The name of the output PDB file.

Returns:

None. Writes the 3D structure of the molecule to a PDB file.

Note

This function is utilised by the SmilesToPDB_GenerateRescode function and carries out the same functionality but additionally generates a residue code for the pdb file generated. These generated residue codes are stored in a database.

sw_basic_functions.estimated_volume(pdb_file_path)[source]

sw_basic_functions.has_rings(mol)[source]
sw_basic_functions.pdb_to_mol(pdb_filename)[source]

Converts a PDB file to a molecule object.

Parameters: - pdb_filename (str): Path to the PDB file.

Returns: Chem.Mol or None: A molecule object if conversion is successful, else None.

The function reads the content of the PDB file, converts it to a molecule object, and assigns chiral tags based on the molecular structure. If the conversion is unsuccessful or the PDB file is empty, None is returned.
